introduction: This video discusses the reasons behind the slow performance of the SELECT * statement in a relational database. It covers the concept of pages in a database, how they are read, and the role of shared memory in the process.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding Pages in a Database
content: Explanation of how pages are stored in a database.
Discussion on the fixed size of database pages.
Explanation of how page numbers are determined.
Comparison of page sizes between different databases.

sections.title: Section 2: Reading Pages in a Database
content: Explanation of how to read a page from a database.
Discussion on the limitations of reading from disk.
Explanation of how page sizes affect reading performance.
Comparison of reading performance between different databases.

sections.title: Section 3: Shared Memory and Performance
content: Explanation of shared memory in a database.
Discussion on how shared memory improves performance.
Explanation of how shared memory affects query performance.
Comparison of shared memory performance between different databases.

sections.title: Section 4: Page Caching and Performance
content: Explanation of page caching in a database.
Discussion on how page caching improves performance.
Explanation of how page caching affects query performance.
Comparison of page caching performance between different databases.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion and Best Practices
content: Summary of key takeaways from the video.
Discussion on best practices for optimizing database performance.
Explanation of the importance of understanding database architecture.
Final thoughts on the importance of performance optimization.
